bibl.title: Afterlives of a Tragic Poet: The Hypothesis in the Hellenistic Reception of Euripides.
bibl.note: Discusses P. Oxy. XXVII, 2455 (= M.-P.3 453; LDAB 925) and Pap. Lugd.-Bat. XXV, 2 (= M.-P.3 454.21; LDAB 904).

bibl.title: Ancient Scholarship and Grammar. Archetypes, Concepts and Contexts.

bibl.seg: Bing Peter, Afterlives of a Tragic Poet: The Hypothesis in the Hellenistic Reception of Euripides.

Stephanos Matthaios, Franco Montanari and Antonios Rengakos (Edd.), Ancient Scholarship and Grammar. Archetypes, Concepts and Contexts = Trends in Classics. Supplementary Volumes. 8 (Berlin - New York, 2011) pp. 201-206.
Discusses P. Oxy. XXVII, 2455 (= M.-P.3 453; LDAB 925) and Pap. Lugd.-Bat. XXV, 2 (= M.-P.3 454.21; LDAB 904).
